required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Arterial Stiffness and Decreased Bone Buffering Capacity in Hemodialysis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Arterial Stiffness and Decreased Bone Buffering Capacity in Hemodialysis Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
Renal patients have an increased risk for cardiovascular complications. There is also increased vascular calcification and bone metabolism is similarly abnormal in patients with chronic kidney disease.
In dialysis patients frequent episodes of hypercalcaemia occur. In a healthy bone structure those episodes of hypercalcemia are buffered by the bone. The absence of bone buffering capacity in dialysis patients can be a mechanism for vascular calcifications.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study hypothesis.
Patient with a higher ∆ Calcium (Calcium post - Calcium pre) have a diminished bone buffering capacity indicative for adynamic bone disease compared with patients with smaller ∆ Calcium.
This may result in higher extraosseous calcification and higher pulse wave velocity
∆ PTH/∆ Calcium may reflect the sensitivity and density of the calcium receptors; this may reflect parathyroid "health"

primary_outcome.measure: correlation between calcium increase and pulse wave velocity
primary_outcome.description: correlation between calcium increase and pulse wave velocity

primary_outcome.measure: correlation between calcium change and pth change
primary_outcome.description: correlation between calcium change and pth change

secondary_outcome.measure: correlation between calcium increase and vascular calcifications
secondary_outcome.description: correlation between calcium increase and vascular calcifications

secondary_outcome.measure: correlation between calcium change and bone markers
secondary_outcome.description: correlation between calcium change and bone markers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- maintenance hemodialysis patients
Exclusion Criteria:
- dialysis <3 months
- aortobifemoral graft
- calcium level predialysis >10.5 mg/dl
